item.title: Young brain researchers ponder other careers amid federal funding cuts
item.description: Cuts and disruptions to federal research funding are causing many young brain scientists to reconsider their career choice.

item.title: Judge says he'll approve opioid settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue and Sackler family
item.description: A federal bankruptcy court judge said he will approve OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma's latest deal to settle thousands of lawsuits over the toll of opi...

item.title: Study: Eating ultra-processed foods linked to an increased risk of colorectal cancer
item.description: A new study found that women who eat a lot of ultra-processed foods were 1.5 times more likely to develop pre-cancerous polyps before the age of 50, c...

item.title: Federal special education staff may get their jobs back. But for how long?
item.description: A new deal to end the government shutdown may briefly restore staff to U.S. Education Department offices that had been gutted by layoffs.

item.title: If you're going to be kind to another human, today is the day to do it!
item.description: November 13 is World Kindness Day. Its goal is to encourage acts of kindness. (After all, one kind day is better than none.) Here's a look at the natu...
